UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile, primarily for associating data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity, matches Firebase Auth UID.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user profile was created.

SimulationRun.title: SimulationRun
SimulationRun.description: Records the results and settings of a single plasma fusion simulation session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SimulationRun entity.

userId.description: Reference to the UserProfile that initiated this simulation run.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the simulation run was saved.

durationSeconds.description: The total duration of the simulation run in seconds.

totalEnergyGeneratedMeV.description: The total amount of energy generated in Mega-electronvolts (MeV).

peakFusionRate.description: The highest fusion rate (f/s) achieved during the run.

outcome.description: A qualitative description of the simulation's result (e.g., 'Stable', 'High Yield').

initialParticleCount.description: The number of particles at the start of the simulation.

finalEnergyThreshold.description: The final energy threshold at the end of the run.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Access is restricted to the user whose ID matches '{userId}'.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user, matching `request.auth.uid`.

definition.description: Contains the results of a past simulation run for a specific user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user who owns this simulation run.

params.name: simulationRunId
params.description: The unique ID of the specific simulation run.

firestore.reasoning: The structure is user-centric, nesting all data under `/users/{userId}` for straightforward security rules. `SimulationRun` documents are stored in a dedicated subcollection under each user, containing all relevant data from a simulation session. This denormalization simplifies queries for a user's simulation history, as no joins or lookups to other collections are needed.
